details.overview: Checks you might need to do on a job applicant before you take them on, and how to get a criminal records check

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
Before you can employ someone, you must make sure they’re allowed to work in the UK.

You can be fined up to £10,000 if you can’t show evidence that you checked your employees are allowed to work in the UK.

You might also need to carry out checks on their qualifications, health or criminal record.

Data protection

You must follow the data protection rules for information on job applicants.

parts.title: Health checks
parts.body:
You can ask for a health check before hiring someone if:

  • it’s a legal requirement - eg eye tests for commercial vehicle drivers
  • it’s not a legal requirement but there is a good reason - eg because your insurers need health checks on cycle couriers

You should only ask successful candidates to undergo health checks. Include information about these checks in their offer letter.

The candidate must give you their written consent before you can request a medical report from their doctor. Candidates have the right to see the report and can ask for it to be changed or withheld from you.

Avoiding discrimination

You must make sure your checks don’t:

  • discriminate - eg by doing a health check that discriminates against disabled people and is not necessary for the job
  • discourage people from applying for the job

You can be prosecuted for discriminating against a candidate because of a disability that doesn’t stop them from doing the job.

parts.title: Criminal records checks
parts.body:
How you check if a job applicant has a criminal record depends on what country you’re in.

You must tell the applicant that you’re going to carry out a criminal records check, and tell them why it’s necessary.

England and Wales

If your staff will be working with children or vulnerable adults, you must get a standard or enhanced Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) check before they can start work.

Contact the CRB Information Line to find out which check you need and how to apply. You can’t apply online.

CRB Information Line

0870 90 90 811

You must not apply for a check unless the job needs one. If you’re not sure, read CRB checks: eligible positions guidance.

Basic checks

If the job doesn’t need a standard or enhanced check, you can still get a basic check from Disclosure Scotland (even if you’re in England or Wales). This tells you if someone has any unspent criminal convictions.

Employing ex-offenders

If you carry out criminal record checks, you must have a policy on employing ex-offenders. You must show it to any applicant who asks for it.

Download ‘Sample policy on the recruitment of ex-offenders’ (PDF, 53KB).

Scotland

Get a criminal records checks in Scotland from Disclosure Scotland.

Northern Ireland

Get a criminal records checks in Northern Ireland from AccessNI.

Overseas applicants

You must get a criminal records check if the job needs one. If the worker is from another country, disclosure organisations in the UK probably won’t have any information on them. You can contact their country’s embassy to see if you can get a similar check done in their country.
